body.p: A rule is used in a template.XULElem("template"). The children of the rule are used to declare the conditions in which the rule matches and the content that is generated. A rule may contain template.XULElem("where"), template.XULElem("binding") and/or template.XULElem("action") elements. A condition is defined used a template.XULElem("where") element. For each result that matches all of the conditions, content within the rule's template.XULElem("action") body is generated. The template.XULElem("bindings") element is optional and may specify additional variable bindings to be used.

When no template.XULElem("query") element is used in a template, a default query is used and the simple query syntax may be used for RDF datasources. For more information about this, see the Simple Query Syntax.
